Class ZombieActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
      • game.ZombieActor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Capable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ActorInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Human, Priestess, Zombie

    public abstract class ZombieActor
extends edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
    Base class for Actors in the Zombie World
    Author:
    ram, Kee Pei Jiin, Tan Wei Li

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.Boolean aiming
      a Boolean attribute to keep track if the actor is aiming at its target, initialized as false
      protected Behaviours behaviours
      a Behaviours object which stores a list of Behaviour that can be performed by the actor

    • Constructor Detail

      • ZombieActor

        public ZombieActor(java.lang.String name,
                   char displayChar,
                   int hitPoints,
                   ZombieCapability team)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the actor in zombie world
        displayChar - The character used to represent the actor in display
        hitPoints - The maximum hit points the actor can have before he dies
        team - The team (i.e. ZombieCapability) of the team, used to differentiate between Zombie and Human

    • Method Detail

      • getAllowableActions

        public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actions getAllowableActions(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor otherActor,
                                                             java.lang.String direction,
                                                             edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map)
        Return an Actions object consisting of HumanAttackAction if the current actor is Zombie and the other actor is Human. If the current actor is Human and other actor is Zombie, return an Actions object consisting of ZombieAttackAction.
        Overrides:
        getAllowableActions in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
        Parameters:
        otherActor - the Actor that might be performing attack
        direction - String representing the direction of the other Actor
        map - current GameMap
        Returns:
        A collection of Actions.

      • maxHitPoints

        public int maxHitPoints()
        Getter for maximum hit point of actor
        Returns:
        An integer representing the maximum hit point of the actor

      • hitPoints

        public int hitPoints()
        Getter for current hit point of actor
        Returns:
        An integer representing the current hit point of the actor

      • takeDamage

        public java.lang.String takeDamage(int points,
                                   edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor otherActor,
                                   edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map)
        The ZombieActor takes the damage, i.e. health point is deducted by the damage value of the weapon used in attack
        Parameters:
        points - number of hitpoints to deduct.
        otherActor - The other actor performing the attack action to the current actor.
        map - The map the other actor attacking the current actor is on.
        Returns:
        An empty string.

      • playTurn

        public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action playTurn(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actions actions,
                                                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action lastAction,
                                                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map,
                                                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Display display)
        Return an action which can be performed by the actor in the actor's current turn.
        Specified by:
        playTurn in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
        Parameters:
        actions - list of possible Actions
        lastAction - previous Action, if it was a multiturn action
        map - the map where the current actor is
        display - the Display where the actor's utterances will be displayed
        Returns:
        the Action to be performed

      • getWeapon

        public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Weapon getWeapon()
        Get the weapon this Actor is using. If the current Actor is carrying weapons, returns the first short-ranged weapon in the inventory. Otherwise, returns the Actor's natural fighting equipment e.g. fists.
        Overrides:
        getWeapon in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
        Returns:
        the Actor's short-ranged weapon or natural

      • aimingAtTarget

        public java.lang.Boolean aimingAtTarget()
        Check if actor is aiming at target.
        Returns:
        a boolean which indicates if the actor is aiming at a target.

      • setAimingAtTarget

        public void setAimingAtTarget(java.lang.Boolean aim)
        Set the actor to indicate that it is aiming at a target or not
        Parameters:
        aim - a boolean attribute to be set to actor's attribute to indicate if it is aiming at target or not

      • getAmmunitionBoxInInventory

        public AmmunitionBox getAmmunitionBoxInInventory()
        Get the first ammunition box in actor inventory if there is any.
        Returns:
